generalInfo:
Pakistan’s northern region is blessed with sky rising mountains and, in their lap, lies the mountainous valleys with cultures whose people are warm-hearted, welcoming and friendly. You can enjoy mesmerizing mountain scenery along the awe-inspiring adventurous road which runs by the mighty rivers. This magical journey has been designed to show you a side of Pakistan that many don't know exists. It's an adventure like no another, designed for you so you can meet the people and experience the diverse landscapes in the north of Pakistan.

We embark on this spectacular cultural voyage in the city of Islamabad, the political and administrative city of Pakistan. Driving towards north, we stop at Taxila to visit the remains of the ancient Buddhist civilizations, one of the most alluring archaeological sites in the world. We drive through the beautiful Naran valley to Gilgit, the administrative town of Gilgit Baltistan. The welcoming and friendly inhabitants of Hunza truly make your stay at feel like home. Enjoy magical views from Baltit Fort, the old residence of Mirs of Hunza, standing atop Karimabad, the former capital of Hunza Valley. A walk along the Barbar irrigation channel, with striking views of the Karakoram Mountains, adds more essence to your journey. You will enjoy the beautiful Attabad Lake with its unique blue colour, Gulmit valley surrounded by high mountains and glaciers, and the most scenic Phander valley and its mesmerizing Phander Lake is an experience of lifetime. We will be crossing Shandur Pass, the highest polo ground in the world, and we will reach Mastuj and then Chitral.

Chitral with the unique Kailash Valley (known as the Wearers of Black Robes) – a remaining minority of approximately 3500 people living in three isolated but beautiful valleys known as Bumburet, Rambur and Berir. The people of Kailash have a rich culture and are very headstrong about their identity. These people stand out from the remaining tribes, cultures and communities due to their distinct traditions, religious practices and festivals. After visiting Swat and Peshawar, our trip will conclude in Islamabad, the federal capital of Pakistan.

Aside from the natural beauty, the tour is filled with local authentic experiences like visits to the local woodwork workshop run by women in Hunza, meals with local people and local eateries like Moksha cafe. This trip helps support local economies of the community and empowers some of the local women as we take you to their cafes and workshops.

dayInfo.description: ISLAMABAD Arrival in Islamabad, transfer to hotel. Half day city tour of Islamabad. Overnight stay in Islamabad. Today’s visits/activities/stops include • Shah Faisal Mosque • Lok Virsa (Folk Heritage Museum • Pakistan National Monument • Parliament House (external) • Golra Sharif Railway Museum • President House (external) • Prime Minister House (external) • Supreme Court of Pakistan (external)

ISLAMABAD - NARAN Islamabad-Taxila: 32 kms/45 minutes’ drive Taxila - Naran: 225 kms/ 5.5 hours’ drive Drive to Naran visiting Taxila en-route. Today’s visits/activities/stops include • Taxila Museum • Julian Buddhist Stupa & Monastery • Dharmarajika complex and stupa,
NARAN: Visit Jeel Saif ul Malook, one of the 8th wonders of the world, A beautiful natural lake sat between the mountain peaks of Naran. Spend the day in a relaxed manner enjoying the views.

NARAN – FAIRY MEADOWS Naran – Raikot Bridge: 155kms / 4.5 hours drive Raikot Bridge – Tato: 12kms / 1.5 hours drive Tato – Fairy Meadows: 9kms / 2-3 hours’ hike Altitude Tato: 2560m / 8448F Fairy Meadows: 3310M / 10800F Drive to Raikot Bridge via Babusar Pass, change vehicle and take jeeps to Tato village, a 3 hours’ hike will take us on to Fairy Meadows. Visit includes: • Lulusar Lake • Babusar Pass

FAIRY MEADOWS Beyal Camp: 3500m / 11650F Nanga Parbat Base Camp: 4000m / 13135F The day is available to explore the surroundings of the fairytale meadow. A nice hike takes you closer to the ice giants in the direction of Nanga Parbat base camp if conditions (little or no snow) allow. If you don’t feel like hiking, stay on the fairytale meadow and enjoy the day at the foot of the ninth highest peak on earth. Overnight stay at the day before.

FAIRY MEADOWS - ASTORE Fairy Meadows – Tato: 2 Hours drive Tato – Raikot Bridge: 1 hours drive Raikot – Rama: 65kms / 2.5 hours drive Rama – Astore: 20kms / 1 hour drive Trek down to Tato & drive to Astore Today’s visit includes: • Stop at Thalichi – The Nanga Parbat View Point • Rama Meadow • Rama Lake hike (optional)

ASTORE - DEOSAI PLATEAU - SKARDU Astore- Skardu: 160 kms/7 hours’ drive Drive to Skardu via Deosai Plateau. Today’s visits/activities include • Sheosar Lake • Bara Pani • Deosai plateau • Chota Pani • Great spot for photography of fauna and flora • Sadpara Lake • Manthal Buddha (optional)
SKARDU Full day tour of Skardu. Overnight stay in Skardu. Today’s visits/activities include; • Upper Kachura Lake • Kachura Choq • Visit Katpana Desert • Kharpocho Fort • Sarfaranga Cold Desert
SKARDU-KHAPLU Skardu – Khaplu: 110 kms/3 hours’ drive Drive to Khaplu. Today’s visits/activities include • Driving along Indus River & enchanting valleys of Baltistan • Khaplu Fort • Chaqchan Mosque

Khaplu – Hushe-Khaplu: 120 kms/7 hours’ drive both way Day excursion to Hushe valley, the gateway to Masherbrum Peak, Laila Peak and many more high altitude peaks, glaciers and wilderness treks. Today’s visits/activities include; • Day excursion to Hushe a remote valley of Ghizer district in Baltistan.
Rest day in Khaplu- no activities today

KHAPULO-SKARDU-GILGIT Khaplu – Gilgit: 300 kms/ hours’ drive Drive to Gilgit, the administrative capital of Gilgit-Baltistan province along the River Indus. Today’s visits/activities include; • Travel along the Indus River • Stop at Nanga Parbat view point • Visit the unique place in the world where three great mountain ranges; the Himalaya, the Karakoram and Hindu Kush meet.

KARIMABAD - HUNZA Gilgit-Karimabad Hunza: 106 kms/2.5 hours’ drive. Drive to Karimabad Hunza. After lunch visit Baltit Fort, Karimabad bazar and walk along Barbar water channel. Today’s visits/activities/stops include; • Stop at Rakaposhi View Point Ghulmet • Baltit Fort • Karimabad Bazaar • Walk Along Barbar Water Channel

CENTRAL HUNZA & NAGAR In the morning visit Hoper Nagar and then Altit & Duiker. Today’s visits/activities/stops include; • Ganish Cluster – the oldest settlement of Hunza Valley • Hopar Nagar – from where you have an excellent view of Golden Peak, Ultar Peak, Hunza Peak & Lady Finger. • Altit Fort • Altit Cluster/Altit Village • Sunset from the Eagle’s Nest View Point in Duiker

UPPER HUNZA Karimabad-Atta Abad Lake: 18 kms/25 minutes’ drive Visit Dong rock inscriptions, Gulmit, Hussaini Bridge & Passu in the upper Hunza. Overnight stay at Atta Abad Lake. Today’s visits/activities/stops include; • Dong Rock Inscriptions • Atta Abad Lake • Gulmit Village • Hussaini Bridge • Passu Cones/Passu Cathedrals
UPPER HUNZA Rest day at Attabad Lake, no activities planned.

UPPER HUNZA - GILGIT-GUPIS Attabad Lake-Gilgit: 135 km/2.30 hrs drive Gilgit-Gupis: 109 kms/4 hours’ drive Drive to Gilgit and then to Gupis visiting Kargah Buddha on the way. Today’s visits/activities/stops include • Kargah Buddha • Drive to along Ghizer river • Beautiful villages along the road

GUPIS - MASTUJ Gupis– Mastuj: 150 kms/7 hours’ drive Drive to Mastuj via Phander & Shandur Pass. Today’s activities / visits include; • Phander Lake • Shandur Pass – The highest polo ground in the world

MASTUJ – CHITRAL Mastuj- Chitral: 120 kms/4 hours’ drive Drive from Mastuj to Chitral. Upon arrival transfer to hotel. Half day sightseeing & overnight stay in Chitral. Today’s visits/activities/stops include; • Tirich Mir View Point • Shahi Mosque • Chitral Bazaar
Rest day in Chitral

CHITRAL - KAILASH Chitral – Bumburet Kailash: 22 kms/1 hour’s drive In the morning visit Chitral Gol National Park. After lunch drive to Bumburet via Rambur. Today’s visits/activities/stops include • Chitral Gol National Park • Rambur Valley Kailash

KAILASH Full day for exploring the unique of Kailash Valley and its people. Short walks in the valley. Today’s visits/activities/stops include; • Chitral Museum • Traditional Homes • Their Sacred Places
KAILASH –MINGORA SWAT Bumburet Kailash – Mingora Swat: 246 kms/7 hours’ drive Drive from Kailash to Swat. Upon arrival visit Swat Museum.
SWAT Rest day to relax and do things at your own pace.

MINGORA SWAT –TAKHT-E-BHAI- PESHAWAR Swat- Takht-e-Bhai-Peshawar: 184 kms/4 hours’ drive Drive to Peshawar visiting Takht-e-Bhai and other Ghandhara sites on the way. Today’s visits/activities include • Butkara • Shingardar Stupa • Amluk Dara Stupa • Najigram Stupa • Buddhist Monastery in Takht Bhai

PESHAWAR – ISLAMABAD Peshawar- Islamabad: 186 kms/2.5 hours’ drive Today’s visits/activities include • Peshawar Museum • Mahabat Khan Mosque • Qissa Khawani Bazar • Bala Hissar Fort (exterior) • Saithi House
Departure from Islamabad
